title: Are our phones listening to us, even when we are not using it? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes they do, but not for any other reason than expected by your self. They listen mostly for key words that pertains towards advertising, it's a bit sneaky but have you ever had an ad pop up on a Google search that may have been something you might have talked about or searched for a few days before the ad? That was your divorce listening and compiling information as to what you want,like or were thinking about. You can go to your settings in the phone and make changes in Google privacy settings if it bothers you.

I don’t know if they are listening to us or not but they are tracking us. Example: my husband and I went to a sushi restaurant in Naples. As soon as we sat down my husband received a google message that the restaurant we were dining at received good reviews. We had not been on any app prior to that looking for a restaurant recommendation.
